title: Screamo Treasure Chest.zip
description:
I finally saved files from an old hard drive that had my high school/college music library on it. I was told to separate out the emotional punk rock and share it with my friends and the world. These aren't super high quality files and some of it is poorly organized. Some of it doesn't even really fit the genre but I felt compelled enough to include em, so there you go.

Here's screenshots of the folders therein: http://imgur.com/a/faXNM (ignore the repeats in the "The" section; I cleaned those up)

I tried to add a list of favorites but I realized I would be writing waaay too much on here. So here's a top 16 and then a near random assortment of things I think people should check out. I figure everyone already knows Orchid or City of Caterpillar, so i tried to include things people might otherwise overlook.



TOP 16 (in no order)
1 Tiny Hawks
2 Florence and Libby
3 Meneguar
4 Four Hundred Years
5 Sleepytime Trio
6 Straight, No Chaser
7 Evergreen(KY)
8 The Farewell Bend 
9 Tristeza (tracks are out of order, sorry)
10 Shotmaker
11 Pirouette
12 Gregor Samsa
13 The Clippers
14 The Caution Children
15 please inform the captain this is a hijack
16 Harrison Bergeron



SLEEPER BANGERZ
1994!
About a Million
Ape Up!
Asobi Seksu
Baader Brains
Bright Eyes & Neva Dinova
Cassilis
Cbend
Chauncey Gardiner
Combatwoundedveteran
Curl Up & Die
Damezumari (esp This Day from Hitherandthithering Waters of)
Death to False Screamo (found in Compilations folder)
Ekkaia
Exasperation Missionary
Hoover
Ida Sessions
June of 44
Khonnor
Kayo Dot (Choirs of the Eye)
Kidcrash (jokes)
Lungfish
Make Me
Maximilian Colby
My Favorite Citizen
My Heart to Joy
Nation of Ulysses
Native Nod
Outclassed
Patrick Wolf
Phoenix Bodies
Portraits of Past
Pygmy Lush (old friends)
Rilo Kiley
Robot Ate Me
Rosetta (galilean satellites combined)
Sharks Keep Moving
Sinaloa
Sparklehorse
Spent
Swarrrm
Swedes
Teeth of Mammals
Ten in the Swear Jar
Thanksgiving
The Books
The Candyland Car Crash
The Caution Children
The Jesus Lizard
The Jim Yoshii Pile-up
The Summer We Went West
Toe
Twelve Hour Turn
Versoma


Also let it be known that Baffled on the Seventh Floor by The Candyland Carcrash is officially the best Emo song ever written and Straight, No Chaser was the best band in the powerviolence/screamo/whatever subgenre. And whatever style bands like sleepytime trio/shotmaker/four hundred years/max colby etc played is and was the best emo subgenre. Thanks.
-raf
